title: Voice of the Mirror: 'Lying Boris fails again in yet another humiliation'
text:

Boris Johnson’s “do or die” promise to impose Brexit by October 31 is in tatters in yet another humiliation for the PM.

MPs justifiably refused to be pushed into backing untrustworthy Johnson’s hasty plans.

His macho obsession with the Halloween deadline led to a ludicrously rushed timetable, which backfired spectacularly when the Commons voted 322-308 against it.

The Government has refused to publish an economic impact assessment of its Brexit plan because it knows it will leave people much worse off.

(Image: Getty)

Brexit Secretary Stephen Barclay doesn’t even know how parts of it will operate.

The defeated PM has been forced to pause his proposed legislation, making it ever more clear that he is making it up as he goes along.

But this is too important to decide on the hoof and force through in three days.

The future of our country, our economy and our communities are at stake.

We deserve more than a desperate plan scribbled on the back of cigarette packet.

Kids need help

It’s a shameful indictment of our society that we are failing vulnerable children with special educational needs.

The system should help these youths overcome difficulties and fulfil their potential. But it is a cash-starved, bureaucratic minefield that creates more barriers than it breaks down.

Today’s report from the Commons Education Committee is damning.

Ending this injustice must be a top priority for the next Government.

But building an inclusive education service requires cash, and years of Tory austerity has stripped local authorities bare.

Deliver rights

Amazon must be forced to stop running its British warehouses like sweatshops.

Labour’s Tom Watson slammed the firm’s “modern slavery” after the Mirror’s exposé.

The Government must stop handing contracts to the web giant until it starts treating its workers fairly.
